page.title: 03Scouts/Cubs in Kirton
page.content: Kirton Scouts were started in 1910.They meet at the old school in King Street.There are four leaders.They have between 28 and 30 Scouts in the troop.Boys can join at 11 years and leave at 16.The{Kirton {troop is 75 years old,the oldest in {the county and the second oldest in {the country}.Kirton Cubs were also founded in 1910.They meet at the old Primary School on Thursday evening.Boys join at 8 years old and leave at 11 years old.There are 36 cubs in the pack.The leader of the of the cubs is called Akela,she is Mrs Verdegaal.
